event.title: came to the Columbus Salt Marsh in 1865

data.event: Settlement came to the Columbus Salt Marsh in 1865 with the raising of a quartz mill.
It wasn't until 1871 that borax was discovered near the town's site, and as a result Columbus increased substantially in its importance.
Columbus' zenith occurred around 1875 when there was around 1,000 people in the town.
William Caruthers, in his "Loafing Along Death Valley Trails" (Ontario: Death Valley Publishing Co., 1951) says that Francis M. "Borax" Smith discovered the borax at Columbus Marsh.
